title: 2011 Crown Royal Presents the Matthew and Daniel Hansen 400
text:
The 2011 Crown Royal Presents the Matthew and Daniel Hansen 400 was a <a href="NASCAR">NASCAR</a> <a href="Sprint%20Cup%20Series">Sprint Cup Series</a> stock car race held on April 30, 2011 at <a href="Richmond%20International%20Raceway">Richmond International Raceway</a> in <a href="Richmond%2C%20Virginia">Richmond, Virginia</a>. Contested over 400 laps on the asphalt D-oval, it was the ninth race of the <a href="2011%20NASCAR%20Sprint%20Cup%20Series">2011 Sprint Cup Series season</a>. The race was won by <a href="Kyle%20Busch">Kyle Busch</a> for the <a href="Joe%20Gibbs%20Racing">Joe Gibbs Racing</a> team. <a href="Denny%20Hamlin">Denny Hamlin</a> finished second, and <a href="Kasey%20Kahne">Kasey Kahne</a> clinched third.
Report.
Background.
<a href="Richmond%20International%20Raceway">Richmond International Raceway</a> is one of five <a href="Short%20track%20motor%20racing">short track</a>s to hold NASCAR races; the others are <a href="Bristol%20Motor%20Speedway">Bristol Motor Speedway</a>, <a href="Dover%20International%20Speedway">Dover International Speedway</a>, <a href="Martinsville%20Speedway">Martinsville Speedway</a>, and <a href="Phoenix%20International%20Raceway">Phoenix International Raceway</a>. The NASCAR race makes use of the track's standard configuration, a four-turn short track <a href="Oval%20track%20racing">oval</a> that is long. The track's turns are <a href="Banked%20turn">banked</a> at fourteen degrees. The front stretch, the location of the finish line, is banked at eight degrees while the back stretch has two degrees of banking. The racetrack has seats for 97,912 spectators.
